SEARCH
Package org.cloudbus.cloudsim.power.models

Interface PowerModel

All Known Implementing Classes:
PowerModelCubic, PowerModelLinear, PowerModelSpecPower, PowerModelSpecPowerHpProLiantMl110G3PentiumD930, PowerModelSpecPowerHpProLiantMl110G4Xeon3040, PowerModelSpecPowerHpProLiantMl110G5Xeon3075, PowerModelSpecPowerIbmX3250XeonX3470, PowerModelSpecPowerIbmX3250XeonX3480, PowerModelSpecPowerIbmX3550XeonX5670, PowerModelSpecPowerIbmX3550XeonX5675, PowerModelSqrt, PowerModelSquare
public interface PowerModel
The PowerModel interface needs to be implemented in order to provide a model of power consumption of hosts, depending on utilization of a critical system component, such as CPU.
If you are using any algorithms, policies or workload included in the power package please cite the following paper:
  • Anton Beloglazov, and Rajkumar Buyya, "Optimal Online Deterministic Algorithms and Adaptive Heuristics for Energy and Performance Efficient Dynamic Consolidation of Virtual Machines in Cloud Data Centers", Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experience (CCPE), Volume 24, Issue 13, Pages: 1397-1420, John Wiley invalid input: '&' Sons, Ltd, New York, USA, 2012
Since:
CloudSim Toolkit 2.0
Author:
Anton Beloglazov, Anton Beloglazov

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    getPower(double utilization)
    Gets power consumption of the Power Model, according to the utilization percentage of a critical resource, such as CPU.

  • Method Details

    • getPower

      double getPower(double utilization) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Gets power consumption of the Power Model, according to the utilization percentage of a critical resource, such as CPU.
      Parameters:
      utilization - the utilization percentage (between [0 and 1]) of a resource that is critical for power consumption.
      Returns:
      the power consumption
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the utilization percentage is not between [0 and 1]
